description: Imports the certificate revocation list (CRL). A CRL is a list of certificates that have been revoked by the issuing certificate Authority (CA).In order to be properly imported, a CRL must be in PEM format. IAM Roles Anywhere validates against the CRL before issuing credentials. Required permissions: rolesanywhere:ImportCrl.

parameters.name: crlData
parameters.description: The x509 v3 specified certificate revocation list (CRL).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate revocation list (CRL).

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A list of tags to attach to the certificate revocation list (CRL). (dict) --- A label that consists of a key and value you define. The tag key. The tag value.

parameters.name: trustAnchorArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the TrustAnchor the certificate revocation list (CRL) will provide revocation for.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the certificate revocation list (CRL) was created.

nested_items.name: crlArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the certificate revocation list (CRL).

nested_items.name: crlData
nested_items.description: The state of the certificate revocation list (CRL) after a read or write operation.

nested_items.name: crlId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the certificate revocation list (CRL).

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the certificate revocation list (CRL) is enabled.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the certificate revocation list (CRL).

nested_items.name: trustAnchorArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the TrustAnchor the certificate revocation list (CRL) will provide revocation for.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the certificate revocation list (CRL) was last updated.
